Dear Newkirk,
My name is Scott Kempenich and I am excited to serve Newkirk Public School as the new Superintendent. I grew up in Wagoner and attended the University of Oklahoma where I was blessed enough to be a part of the 2000 National Championship. I have been married for twenty-two years to Christa and we have two children, Jaxon and Gracie. I have served as an educator for a total of nineteen years, the last twelve years I have served as a school administrator. I have been a teacher, coach, assistant principal, principal and superintendent in my professional career. I am an educational leader that strives to provide the best education possible to all students. I know there are many questions about what the school year will look like in this new era of Covid-19. In the next several weeks we will be working diligently to create safe schooling options for all employees and students in the 2020-2021 school year. I look forward to meeting all school employees, students, parents and community members.

post_text:
Newkirk School District 125 is launching a new mobile app
that helps students, parents, and community members
know what is happening on campus, right from their
phones. We know that families are using smartphones
as a primary means to communicate. That’s why we’ve
created an app that is custom-built for mobile. On the app,
you can find cafeteria menus, real-time sports scores,
contact information for staff, and event information. You
can download the app for free from the Apple App Store or
Google Play.

Three Main Benefits:
1) Know what’s going on at school.
Ex: Find real-time updates from the website’s live feed
about stories happening inside the classroom, on the
football field, or in the art studio.

2) Connect with teachers and administrators.
Ex: Learn about parent-teacher conferences, access staff
contact information, and quickly find out about district news.

3) Stay up-to-date with school information.
Ex: Receive updates about events occurring on campus,
the daily cafeteria menu, required forms, and even
emergency notifications.

It’s everything Newkirk Schools,
in your pocket.

BOND ISSUE UPDATE - January 9th, 2018

Things are progressing with the middle school roof. A significant amount of work has been completed in the last week.

Our school found out yesterday that we did receive the FEMA grant for the safe-rooms that are to be included with the Early Childhood Center and the Gymnasium. The total monetary portion of the grants total $1,501,496.00.

Construction will now begin soon on these two buildings. I want to thank all stakeholders involved for their patience in waiting for this grant. It will be a huge boost in the construction of these two buildings.
